parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Blind, physically or mentally. From, tuphoo; opaque, i.e. blind.
A leader, guide; met: an instructor, teacher. From hodos and hegeomai; a conductor (teacher).
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.
Blind, physically or mentally. From, tuphoo; opaque, i.e. blind.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To lead, guide; met: I instruct, teach. From hodegos; to show the way (teach).
Blind, physically or mentally. From, tuphoo; opaque, i.e. blind.
Both (of two). Comparative of amphi; both.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A pit, ditch. Akin to bathuno; a hole; specially, a cistern.
